title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
01:52 <florinciu> has quit  
02:56 <DrLou> has quit  
03:20 <SvenDowideit> has quit  
03:20 <SvenDowideit> has joined #xwiki  
03:28 <sburjan`> has quit  
03:42 <venkatesh> has joined #xwiki  
03:42 <venkatesh> has quit  
03:55 <abusenius> has quit  
06:48 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
06:51 <SvenDowideit> has quit  
06:55 <SvenDowideit> has joined #xwiki  
07:00 <jvdrean> has quit  
07:43 <sburjan`> has joined #xwiki  
07:45 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
07:54 <jstoldt> has joined #xwiki  
07:54 <jstoldt> good morning  
07:58 <vmassol> morning  
08:00 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
08:16 <jstoldt> what is the context of admin.content.description "Manipulate the content of your wiki."?  
08:16 <jstoldt> is it manipulate as in edit?  
08:19 <jstoldt> admin.import.description: "Import pages or applications into the wiki." <-- shouldn't that be documents instead of pages? referring to the discussion that was in the channel some weeks ago...  
08:24 <jstoldt> admin.presentation.description: "Modify the header, change the panels display, customize the skin and color themes." <-- are we speaking of the displayed header at the beginning of the page or the html header here?  
08:28 <npm\_> has joined #xwiki  
08:32 <npm> has quit  
08:51 <vmassol> jstoldt: checking for admin.content.description  
08:52 <vmassol> FTM I don't see it used  
08:52 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
08:53 <vmassol> Author: sdumitriu  
08:53 <vmassol> Date: 2011-02-05 01:21:59 +0100 (Sat, 05 Feb 2011)  
08:53 <vmassol> New Revision: 34423  
08:53 <vmassol> Modified:  
08:53 <vmassol>   platform/core/trunk/xwiki-core/src/main/resources/ApplicationResources.properties  
08:53 <vmassol> Log:  
08:53 <vmassol> XAADMINISTRATION-211: Full UI redesign of the administration application  
08:53 <vmassol> New localization keys  
08:54 <vmassol> hmmm strange I can't find it in the code  
08:55 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
08:56 <vmassol> http://xwiki.markmail.org/search/?q=%22admin.content.description%22  
09:01 <vmassol> jstoldt: ok it's used in platform/xwiki-applications/trunk/administration/src/main/resources/XWiki/AdminSheet.xml  
09:01 <vmassol> +  #set ($category.description = $msg.get("admin.${http://category.id/}.description"))  
09:03 <jstoldt> so in meta context, what is it supposed to mean there? edit or meddle with the looks?  
09:04 <vmassol> jstoldt: we have a new admin UI now  
09:04 <jstoldt> yeah, i read about it  
09:05 <vmassol> jstoldt: see http://tinypic.com/view.php?pic=25g9ul5&s=7  
09:06 <vmassol> (check the Content section)  
09:06 <jstoldt> ah, i think i'll understand it now. thanks for the hints  
09:25 <+sburjan> vmassol: fyi I willbe testing on IE browsers today  
09:25 <vmassol> ok  
09:25 <+sburjan> vmassol: release today ?  
09:25 <vmassol> that's the date we listed  
09:26 <+sburjan> I'm interested in the real release date .. if it's gonna be today  
09:26 <vmassol> me too  
09:26 <jstoldt> X-D  
09:27 <vmassol> I'm also interested in knowing if the stock exchange is going to go up or down tomorrow  
09:29 <+sburjan> ;)  
09:30 <+sburjan> do we have a release manager for M2 ?  
09:30 <jstoldt> About: admin.content.description --> i think the "your" should be replaced with "the" to be less addressing and match the other descriptions  
09:31 <jstoldt> any comments on that?  
09:31 <jstoldt> also, what about admin.presentation.description?  
09:32 <jstoldt> is it displayed page header or html header?  
09:32 <vmassol> mflorea: you're ok to fo the M2 too? (ie continue the 3.0 release cycle)  
09:34 <+mflorea> vmassol: hmm, today? I was hopping to fix some wysiwyg bugs and integrate the office presentation viewer before the release.  
09:34 <vmassol> today is release day mflorea  
09:34 <vmassol> it's not like we didn't know :)  
09:35 <jstoldt> what's the office presentation viewer? sound neat!  
09:35 <+mflorea> sure, but being the release manager requires to spent more time on the release and less on finishing work for that release  
09:36 <vmassol> I'd really like us to be clean in term of release dates (time boxing) as much as possible otherwise it's the end, everybody slips and we can't manage a schedule  
09:36 <vmassol> but can't you do that for M3?  
09:36 <+sburjan> we could delay it 1-2 days  
09:36 <vmassol> sburjan: I'd rather not  
09:36 <vmassol> (if we can avoid it)  
09:36 <+sburjan> because I'm still testing ..  
09:36 <vmassol> right now I don't see anything that forces us to delay  
09:36 <vmassol> sburjan: you're late too  
09:37 <vmassol> (in that case)  
09:37 <vmassol> we're not going to wait for you sburjan either  
09:37 <vmassol> you knew the date too  
09:37 <vmassol> :)  
09:38 <+sburjan> :)  
09:38 <vmassol> I also have stuff to commit but I'll wait for M3 (they're not critical)  
09:38 <vmassol> guys if we don't respect the dates they don't mean aynthing  
09:38 <vmassol> then sorin starts to delay his tests thinking that the release will be delayed "as usual", etc  
09:39 <+mflorea> vmassol: good, I'll start the release process after lunch, I'll send the mail now  
09:39 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
09:39 <vmassol> IMO the only thing that could delay the release is a blokcing bug  
09:39 <+sburjan> vmassol: yes, this is what usually happens to me  
09:39 <vmassol> mflorea: thanks  
09:40 <+sburjan> I try to test as later as I can so testing really means something, because if I test exactyle in the time between the releases, a lot of commits can be made after I test .. and a lot of bugs could be introduced  
09:40 <+sburjan> I mean blockers for example  
09:41 <vmassol> sburjan: it's a bad idea IMO  
09:41 <vmassol> I already expressed my view on this  
09:41 <vmassol> if you find a bug on the last day of the release how are we supposed to fix it befoer the release?  
09:41 <vmassol> IMO you have 2 choices  
09:41 <+sburjan> that's also a good question  
09:41 <vmassol> 1) your tests are there to help the current release and you need to test at least 1 week before the release and as soon as some new feature is committed  
09:42 <vmassol> or  
09:42 <vmassol> 2) your tests are for the following releases and you test just after a release is done  
09:42 <vmassol> and what find are stuff to be fixed for the next release  
09:42 <vmassol> hmm there can be a 3rd possibility  
09:42 <vmassol> (which we wanted to do but haven't done yet)  
09:43 <vmassol> 3) stage the release and let is be avail for testing for several days  
09:43 <vmassol> For 3) to work we would need to put the staging in our planning schedule  
09:43 <vmassol> IMO we could do that only for the final release  
09:44 <+sburjan> FTM I'd go with 1)  
09:44 <vmassol> allow for 1 full week of staging  
09:45 <vmassol> hmm we could consider our RC to be staging actually  
09:45 <vmassol> so your testing strategy sburjan could be a mix  
09:45 <vmassol> you do 1) for milestones and 3) for the RC  
09:45 <vmassol> so 1) is ongoing best effort in teting  
09:45 <vmassol> tedting  
09:45 <vmassol> teting  
09:46 <vmassol> testing  
09:46 <vmassol> there you go ;)  
09:46 <+sburjan> :)  
09:46 <+sburjan> ok  
09:46 <+sburjan> I'm gonna switch tactics then  
09:46 <vmassol> and you have to test the whole thing when it's published in RC too and you're the one to give us the green light for the final  
09:47 <+sburjan> I test all releases  
09:47 <vmassol> I'm talking about when you have to test  
09:47 <vmassol> 1) is before releases  
09:47 <vmassol> 3) is after RC is released  
09:47 <+sburjan> ij  
09:47 <+sburjan> ok  
09:48 <vmassol> note to self: if we were to remove milestones and RC we could apply the same strategy but with a staging period for each release  
09:50 <+sburjan> XWIKI-5960  
09:51 <vmassol> it's minor and not really a bug  
09:51 <jstoldt> http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XPSWIZZLE << URL outdated  
09:51 <+sburjan> I know  
09:51 <vmassol> (IMO)  
09:51 <vmassol> I wouldn't call it a release blocker  
09:51 <+sburjan> I'm just doing my job, reporting everything .. not trying to block the release  
09:51 <vmassol> sburjan: why do you list it?  
09:52 <vmassol> I thought you were listing it to remind it to us  
09:52 <+sburjan> ok, I won't list them .. I got used to listing them after I report  
09:52 <+sburjan> no no :)  
09:52 <vmassol> well we get jira to do that automatically  
09:52 <vmassol> ALL issues are sent to the notifications list  
09:52 <+sburjan> i know  
09:53 <vmassol> what you can do which is good though is to remind us of ones you consider blockers  
09:53 <vmassol> (in case they slip through)  
09:53 <+sburjan> ok  
09:53 <+sburjan> the Safari bug is blocker for the release. I won't give green light on final if that's not fixed :)  
09:54 <+sburjan> final meaning 3.0 final  
09:54 <vmassol> yes we need to find out why it's happening, don't know if sdumitriu found more about it or not  
09:54 <@sdumitriu> No, not yet  
09:55 <@sdumitriu> It \*should\* work  
09:55 <@sdumitriu> I'll have to restart in Windows at some point  
09:56 <+sburjan> sdumitriu: what should be the JIRA place for report send page by email problems ?  
09:57 <jstoldt> sdumitriu: [08:24] <jstoldt> admin.presentation.description: "Modify the header, change the panels display, customize the skin and color themes." <-- are we speaking of the displayed header at the beginning of the page or the html header here?  
10:04 <npm\_\_> has joined #xwiki  
10:04 <npm\_> has quit  
10:05 <jstoldt> i just found a weird bug in 2.7-snapshot  
10:06 <+sburjan> we have some js errors on IE's on new Admin Interface  
10:06 <jstoldt> i tried to retrieve my user name and got this: "your username is: ${xwiki.getDocument($results.get(0)).name}"  
10:09 <+mflorea> guys we have lots of selenium tests failing. I'm handling the wysiwyg ones (just 3) right now, but there are 21 in ui-tests and 15 in selenium tests. I'll take a look after I finish with the wysiwyg but any help is appreciated.  
10:11 <+mflorea> vmassol: what should I do if clirr fails the build because it is "Unable to locate enclosing class"? exclude that class?  
10:13 <+sburjan> mflorea:  I think tests are failing because the ui change in administration menu  
10:13 <+mflorea> sure, but they have to be updated  
10:13 <vmassol> mflorea: hmm yes looks like a CLIRR issue, I think we had an exclude in the core's pom.xml for one such class… another option is to make that class not nested  
10:14 <vmassol> mflorea: I'll check the tests in a few minutes but we'll probably need sdumitriu's help  
10:14 <+mflorea> vmassol: it's a class with one line so it's not worth to move it to the top. I'll try to exclude it  
10:19 <vmassol> sdumitriu: does your last commit on the admin app mean it's no longer compatible with pre 3.0 core?  
10:19 <vmassol> the pom still says that the req is 2.5 on core  
10:20 <vmassol> note: I didn't commit the getPlainTitle() earlier on it not to break the compat with 2.5  
10:20 <vmassol> (just noticed a svn conflict when updating admin app this morning locally since I still had that uncomitted changed locally)  
10:20 <vmassol> s/changed/change/  
10:24 <florinciu> has joined #xwiki  
10:28 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: Yes, it uses plainTitle now  
10:28 <@sdumitriu> mflorea: Most tests fail because the administration app changed structure  
10:28 <vmassol> the question sdumitriu is about handling requirements  
10:29 <+mflorea> sdumitriu: ok, we have to update them  
10:29 <@sdumitriu> And since hudson. and maven.x.o were down, I couldn't fix the tests  
10:29 <@sdumitriu> I'm starting on it now  
10:29 <@sdumitriu> mflorea: If you want to fix some of those as well, let's split them  
10:29 <@sdumitriu> What do you prefer? ui or selenium?  
10:29 <vmassol> 2 issues: 1) we need to decide if we want the admin app to not be backward compat and 2) if we want that we need to update the pom I think  
10:30 <vmassol> (again right now the pom says 2.5)  
10:30 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: +1 for no backwards compatibility  
10:30 <vmassol> (it needs a dep on web probably)  
10:30 <+mflorea> sdumitriu: start with the ui-tests and I'll move to selenium after I finish with the wysiwyg.  
10:30 <vmassol> sdumitriu: can you fix the pom?  
10:31 <vmassol> i.e. use the correct dep and version  
10:31 <vmassol> for plaintitle it's core for sure but 3.0M1 I think (or was it 2.7?)  
10:32 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: Done  
10:32 <vmassol> ok  
10:32 <vmassol> sdumitriu: this is very important  
10:32 <vmassol> since we're going to start using the extension manager soon  
10:32 <vmassol> and it needs that info  
10:32 <vmassol> so we need to start being careful about our deps  
10:32 <vmassol> it's not easy  
10:38 <@sdumitriu> I know  
10:39 <vmassol> I wonder how we're going to manage that in a clean manner….  
10:39 <vmassol> we'll probably need some tooling to help us  
10:39 <vmassol> or an array of hudson agent  
10:40 <vmassol> (testing with various version of extensions)  
10:42 <@sdumitriu> Hard to test  
10:42 <@sdumitriu> Since Velocity will simply print verbatim what it doesn't understand  
10:42 <vmassol> we could also modify xwiki.org to allow users to report compatibilities  
10:42 <@sdumitriu> You'd have to manually check the output agains some HTML  
10:42 <@sdumitriu> Unit tests  
10:43 <vmassol> sdumitriu: well some features will not work anymore  
10:43 <vmassol> so if you test those features you'll notice they're broken  
10:46 <arkub> has joined #xwiki  
10:47 <@sdumitriu> sburjan: I think XWIKI-5960 was already reported  
10:47 <jstoldt> could anyone try and explain why       \* \*\*${xwiki.getDocument($item).name}\*\* is not interpreted as correct velocity?  
10:48 <+sburjan> sdumitriu: let me check  
10:48 <jstoldt> it only shows "${xwiki.getDocument($item).name}" in bold  
10:49 <+sburjan> sdumitriu: I don't see it. It was reported for M1 in the incubator page.Now i created a JIRA for it  
10:50 <@sdumitriu> jstoldt: xwiki.getDocument returns null when the current user doesn't have view right on that document  
10:50 <vmassol> jstoldt: it means your api call is not correct, the method doesn't exist with that signature  
10:50 <vmassol> (ah or what sergiu said ;))  
10:50 <@sdumitriu> But I think it's fixed in the most recent version of forgot username  
10:50 <@sdumitriu> jstoldt: Which version are you testing?  
10:50 <jstoldt> well, problem is, that code i get this when importing latest 2.7-snapshot xar into latest 2.7-snapshot war when trying to retrieve the ForgotUsername  
10:51 <jstoldt> also, ResetPassword won't work for me...  
10:51 <@sdumitriu> Same, fixed in the latest version  
10:51 <@sdumitriu> (should be)  
10:51 <@sdumitriu> (3.0M1)  
10:51 <jstoldt> i can't move to 3.0M1 now  
10:52 <jstoldt> this platform here is supposed to run stable when i leave in 3 weeks time  
10:52 <@sdumitriu> You can import those documents  
10:52 <@sdumitriu> They don't use new APIs  
10:52 <@sdumitriu> Just that the code was refactored a bit  
10:52 <jstoldt> you mean it's not fixed in the 2.7???  
10:52 <@sdumitriu> No  
10:53 <jstoldt> why is that?  
10:53 <arkub> has quit  
10:53 <@sdumitriu> It was a major rewrite of the code, with new translation keys  
10:53 <jstoldt> yeah, i noticed so much when i adapted it to use old code... but this is something that should also be fixed for 2.7.1...  
10:54 <jstoldt> i mean, this is pretty fundamental functionality  
10:54 <@sdumitriu> OK...  
10:54 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
10:54 <@sdumitriu> Well, it's in the administration application  
10:55 <@sdumitriu> So it doesn't really follow the xe version numbers  
10:55 <vmassol> (but that app requires 3.0 now ;))  
10:55 <jstoldt> fair enough, still, there should be a way to import this to 2.7 without having to repack the xwiki core jar  
10:55 <vmassol> (we can branch of course)  
10:55 <@sdumitriu> You could try to import the 1.45 version of the administration xar  
10:56 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: 1.45 didn't require it yet  
10:57 <arkub> has joined #xwiki  
10:58 <jstoldt> well, i found out why it did not work here anymore after i adapted the patch for 2.7 a few weeks back... apparently i overwrote that patch  
10:58 <jstoldt> still, it should be fixed in a 2.7.1 release  
11:01 <@sdumitriu> jstoldt: OK  
11:01 <jstoldt> thanks a bunch  
11:11 <evalica> has quit  
11:12 <jstoldt> do you want the documents i use now?  
11:12 <jstoldt> they use the old translations for the most part, iirc  
11:42 <jstoldt> is there a way to retrieve the URL of the xwiki instance without having to get the external URL of a doc and then stripping it from /bin/view/...?  
12:03 <sdumitriu> has quit  
12:05 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
12:18 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
12:24 <jstoldt> any idea how #set($wikiurl = $passwordResetURL.substring(0, $passwordResetURL.indexOf("/bin"))) could cause velocity errors?  
12:24 <jstoldt> if i just use $passwordResetURL.substring(0, $passwordResetURL.indexOf("/bin")) it displays the expected string  
12:31 <jstoldt> oh, so apparently the problem is not that it throws an error but that $wikiurl is not being set... wtf?!  
12:33 <@cjdelisle> just use this:  
12:33 <@cjdelisle> $passwordResetURL.substring(0, $passwordResetURL.indexOf("/bin"))  
12:33 <@cjdelisle> And see what it prints  
12:34 <@cjdelisle> if you're looking for http://www.mysite.com/ then you might not get it, a lot of urls are internal.  
12:34 <@cjdelisle> So if $pwRstUrl is internal then it will start with /bin  
12:34 <jstoldt> nevermind, it was my bad....  
12:34 <jstoldt> sorry for the fuss  
12:35 <jstoldt> i cut off the / at the end it then failed on #set($wikiname = $wikiname.substring(2, $wikiname.indexOf("/", 3)))  
12:35 <jstoldt> \*ashamed\*  
12:36 <@cjdelisle> oh  
12:37 <jstoldt> debugging velocity is a pain :(  
12:40 <DrLou> has joined #xwiki  
12:40 <xipe> has quit  
12:41 <xipe> has joined #xwiki  
12:42 <jstoldt> how can i enforce sending text messages via mail instead of html?  
12:45 <@cjdelisle> Are you using Invitation app?  
12:45 <jstoldt> no, i want it for sending the reset token for lost password  
12:45 <jstoldt> changed something in the content and want to be sure it also works for text email instead of html email  
12:46 <@cjdelisle> I don't know much about that piece of code.  
12:47 <@cjdelisle> Does anyone know when 3.0M2 will branch?  
12:48 <jstoldt> cjdelisle: there was some discussion earlier and i think it was agreed that mflorea starts releasing after his lunch  
12:49 <+mflorea> cjdelisle: wdym by branch?  
12:49 <+mflorea> I'm going to start the release process soon  
12:49 <+mflorea> the release was planned for today  
12:50 <@cjdelisle> You will not branch the trunk when you release?  
12:50 <rrodriguez> has joined #xwiki  
12:51 <@cjdelisle> I thought branching was customary, otherwise nobody could commit all day until the release process was finished.  
12:51 <+mflorea> nu, branches are created only for RC  
12:52 <+mflorea> for milestones you have to wait for the specific module to be released and then commit. You don't have to wait for the entire release process to end, just for the specific module you're working on.  
12:53 <+mflorea> I can ping you. What module do you want to commit to?  
12:53 <@cjdelisle> xwiki-core and ui-tests  
12:54 <@cjdelisle> It's not really a bother though, I can commit in my local git repo.  
12:54 <+mflorea> ok  
12:55 <jstoldt> cjdelisle: speaking of local git repo... how do you work with the source code? do you have one directory for working and another one for having a repository so that you don't mix up stuff? asking out of curiosity  
12:56 <@cjdelisle> I spent about 1 week pulling everything ever committed through git-svn  
12:57 <@cjdelisle> I have a single git repo which mirrors the entire svn server.  
12:58 <@cjdelisle> On the bright side, I can make one commit which alters files in multiple top level projects.  
12:58 <@cjdelisle> On the dark side, all of the svn branches and all of the tags are sitting there as directories, git only knows of one main trunk.  
12:59 <@cjdelisle> What I do is edit some files, compile, git add, git commit, git svn dcommit  
13:00 <jstoldt> ah, so you do all your development work within the git repository directory  
13:00 <@cjdelisle> or edit files, compile, git add, git branch && git checkout, commit to branch, switch back to master.  
13:01 <jstoldt> i do it a little different because i like to keep my repository clean until i do commits. so i have a directory in which i work and whenever i want to commit something i copy the changes into the git directory and then i commit  
13:02 <@cjdelisle> You can do the same with branches  
13:02 <@cjdelisle> git co -b workspace  
13:02 <@cjdelisle> play  
13:02 <@cjdelisle> git co master  
13:02 <@cjdelisle> git merge workspace  
13:02 <@cjdelisle> commit  
13:02 <@cjdelisle> err dcommit  
13:03 <@cjdelisle> If using git-svn  
13:03 <@cjdelisle> otherwise git push  
13:03 <jstoldt> yeah... well, i switched from CVS to Git so i tried to continue the way i always did it  
13:03 <jstoldt> but it might be worth changing my process...  
13:03 <@cjdelisle> hehe everyone who uses cvs/svn uses that same pattern.  
13:03 <jstoldt> you mean the oen i use?  
13:03 <@cjdelisle> Actually I didn't when I used it.  
13:04 <@cjdelisle> svn up  
13:04 <@cjdelisle> hack  
13:04 <jstoldt> ?  
13:04 <@cjdelisle> svn diff > ../../../patches/mypatch.patch  
13:04 <@cjdelisle> svn clean  
13:04 <@cjdelisle> oh no it was svn revert  
13:04 <@cjdelisle> I think.  
13:05 <@cjdelisle> Then ~/svn-clean.pl  
13:05 <@cjdelisle> then svn up  
13:05 <@cjdelisle> then I had a clean repo  
13:05 <@cjdelisle> And I could apply my patch and commit.  
13:06 <@cjdelisle> Git is better than svn/cvs. To us committers it doesn't matter, we have the same power either way.  
13:06 <jstoldt> sounds no less hacky then what i do :-D  
13:06 <jstoldt> yeah, got to love git myself... i think it's a huge leap!  
13:06 <@cjdelisle> cvs/svn --> "You have a change? Present us with a patch and we will review it, you may make other offerings in the hope that your patch will be accepted."  
13:07 <@cjdelisle> git --> "You have a change? Fork the tree, become your own wuality controller, integrate it yourself, if it's better we will merge your change into our tree."  
13:08 <jstoldt> yeah  
13:08 <jstoldt> but then, i don't do a lot of collaborative work, code wise, in my projects  
13:08 <jstoldt> which is a bit of a pitty, really  
13:08 <@cjdelisle> cvs/svn is almost like closed source in how it locks people out.  
13:09 <@cjdelisle> be back. coffee
